str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From hupo and deo; to bind under one's feet, i.e. Put on shoes or sandals.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Foundation, firm footing; preparation, readiness. From hetoimazo; preparation.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
